p: The illuminated bacterial suspension and the nitrocellulose filter were vigorously washed by 10 mL Phosphate-buffered saline (PBS). The suspension was then serially diluted with PBS from 10 0 to 10 − 4, and 100 μL of each of the serially diluted bacterial suspensions was spread onto a Mueller-Hinton agar plate. Meanwhile, bacterial test suspensions without VUV illumination were spread onto Mueller Hinton agar to obtain the initial colony-forming units (CFU) before the use of VUV light disinfection as control.
